adjectives.description: fractional (comparative more fractional, superlative most fractional)

examples: The two women exchanged a glance, then a fractional nod of agreement.

entries.meaning: (chemistry) Relating to a process or product of fractional distillation.
(grammar) An expression of a fractional number.
examples: In English, most ordinals double as fractionals — "third", "fourth", and so on — with the exception of "second", whose corresponding fractional is "half".

entries.meaning: Partial ownership of a property, such as real estate or a chartered airplane, such that each partial owner has use of the property for only a portion of the time.
examples: A fractional is much more expensive than a traditional timeshare, but to many people, it's worth it.

entries.meaning: (chemistry) Relating to a fraction in a material distillation or separation process.
